main event: An investigation into UFO sightings reported by Mrs. Yvonne Gattuso in Hazelcrest, Illinois on April 9, 1967.
interesting points: Mrs. Gattuso observed UFOs for several months leading to the investigation,Some sightings included known planets and stars which were mistaken for UFOs,The only potentially unconventional object was an oval metallic one observed in August 1966,The investigation suggested several other sightings were misidentified as jets or atmospheric phenomena,The witnesses displayed a lack of understanding regarding basic astronomy which contributed to the confusion.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects, possibly including Venus and a metallic object
witness description: Mrs. Yvonne Gattuso, her sister-in-law, and her husband
